cell.html: When Jack sells his cow for some lousy looking beans, his mother goes into a rage and throws the beans out the window. However, Jack soon discovers that those beans were no ordinary beans and he begins a journey to get the riches that lies on top of the beanstalk. But, Jack soon discovers that the riches are not the only things on the beanstalk.
cell.text: When Jack sells his cow for some lousy looking beans, his mother goes into a rage and throws the beans out the window. However, Jack soon discovers that those beans were no ordinary beans and he begins a journey to get the riches that lies on top of the beanstalk. But, Jack soon discovers that the riches are not the only things on the beanstalk.

cell.html: Two stories feature Anansi the Spider outsmarting various creatures to get his stories. The first story involves Anansi tricking Snake to get the stories from Tiger. The second story involves Anansi trying to admit to the other animals that he is a man after his mother-in-law dies.
cell.text: Two stories feature Anansi the Spider outsmarting various creatures to get his stories. The first story involves Anansi tricking Snake to get the stories from Tiger. The second story involves Anansi trying to admit to the other animals that he is a man after his mother-in-law dies.

cell.html: East of the Sun West of the Moon
cell.text: East of the Sun West of the Moon

cell.html: When a young girl befriends a mysterious bear, she learns about the curse that has been set upon the bear and embarks on a journey to set him free from the curse.
cell.text: When a young girl befriends a mysterious bear, she learns about the curse that has been set upon the bear and embarks on a journey to set him free from the curse.
The Fool and the Flying Ship

cell.html: When the Tsar of Russia proclaims that whoever builds a flying ship will marry his daughter, a country fool takes the challenge and meets some odd superhumans along the way.
cell.text: When the Tsar of Russia proclaims that whoever builds a flying ship will marry his daughter, a country fool takes the challenge and meets some odd superhumans along the way.
King Midas and the Golden Touch

cell.html: When King Midas is given the gift to turn objects into gold, he learns that there are things that are more precious than any gold in the kingdom.
cell.text: When King Midas is given the gift to turn objects into gold, he learns that there are things that are more precious than any gold in the kingdom.

cell.html: When a young boy leaves his village because the village does not know how to treat the son of a chief, he embarks on a journey to find a village that will treat him with respect.
cell.text: When a young boy leaves his village because the village does not know how to treat the son of a chief, he embarks on a journey to find a village that will treat him with respect.

cell.html: When a Brahmin accidentally releases a tiger, the tiger is bent on eating the Brahmin. However, a clever jackal is the one who helps the Brahmin in his time of need.
cell.text: When a Brahmin accidentally releases a tiger, the tiger is bent on eating the Brahmin. However, a clever jackal is the one who helps the Brahmin in his time of need.

context.text: Rabbit Ears Productions media and release information - Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
# Title Year Released Summary Narrator Illustrator Music Country
Rabbit Ears Productions media and release information

This is the story list of all the stories in the Rabbit Ears Productions series. The stories are usually half-hour specials each series. It includes the summaries, the years, the narrators, the music, and the illustrators of each story.
Please help improve this article with relevant internal links . (February 2008)
This article or section needs to be wikified to meet Wikipedia's quality standards .
Please help improve this article by adding citations to reliable sources . Unverifiable material may be challenged and removed.
This article does not cite any references or sources . (February 2008)
Rabbit Ears Productions media and release information

15Jack and the Beanstalk1991When Jack sells his cow for some lousy looking beans, his mother goes into a rage and throws the beans out the window. However, Jack soon discovers that those beans were no ordinary beans and he begins a journey to get the riches that lies on top of the beanstalk. But, Jack soon discovers that the riches are not the only things on the beanstalk.Michael PalinEdward SorelDavid A. StewartEngland
16Anansi1991Two stories feature Anansi the Spider outsmarting various creatures to get his stories. The first story involves Anansi tricking Snake to get the stories from Tiger. The second story involves Anansi trying to admit to the other animals that he is a man after his mother-in-law dies.Denzel WashingtonSteven GuarnacciaUB40Jamaica
17East of the Sun West of the Moon1991When a young girl befriends a mysterious bear, she learns about the curse that has been set upon the bear and embarks on a journey to set him free from the curse.Max von SydowVivienne FlesherLyle MaysScandinavia
18The Fool and the Flying Ship1991When the Tsar of Russia proclaims that whoever builds a flying ship will marry his daughter, a country fool takes the challenge and meets some odd superhumans along the way.Robin WilliamsHenrik DrescherThe Klezmer Conservatory BandRussia
19King Midas and the Golden Touch1991When King Midas is given the gift to turn objects into gold, he learns that there are things that are more precious than any gold in the kingdom.Michael CaineRodica PratoEllis Marsalis featuring Yo-Yo MaGreece
20Koi and the Kola Nuts1991When a young boy leaves his village because the village does not know how to treat the son of a chief, he embarks on a journey to find a village that will treat him with respect.Whoopi GoldbergReynold RuffinsHerbie HancockAfrica
21The Tiger and the Brahmin1991When a Brahmin accidentally releases a tiger, the tiger is bent on eating the Brahmin. However, a clever jackal is the one who helps the Brahmin in his time of need.Ben KingsleyKurt VargoRavi ShankarIndia
